revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== [[backslang|Backslang]] for {{m|en|penny}}, with additional ''e''. ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|obsolete|costers}} A [[penny]]. #* {{quote-book |en |year=1851 |first=Henry|last=Mayhew|authorlink=Henry Mayhew |title={{w|London Labour and the London Poor}} |volume=1 |page=41 |section=Of the "Penny Gaff" |passage=To discover the kind of entertainment, a lad near me and my companion was asked "if there was any flash dancing." With a knowing wink the boy answered "Lots! show their legs and all, prime!" and immediately the boy followed up this information by a request for a "'''yennep'''" to get a "tib of occabot." }} #* {{quote-book |en |year=1882 |first=George|last=MacDonald|authorlink=George MacDonald |chapter=If I Had a Father |title=[[gutenberg:9191|Stephen Archer and Other Strange Tales]] |section=act 2 |passage=Now what are you two squabblin' over? Oh! Jack's got a '''yennep''', and Jim's iookin' shirty. }} #* {{quote-book |en |year=1978 |first=Rose|last=Ayers |title=The Street Sparrows |passage="Give me two gen, then, and take the whole bloody tol. I've walked me teef orf afore rouf this mornin', and wot 'ave I got? Two bloody '''yenneps'''! I ask yer." }} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=eennpy|Penney}} [[Category:English 2-syllable words]] [[Category:en:Coins]]
